heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 21 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.5°C) and outside temperature (up 3.3°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4253 lux) and cloud levels (up 698 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 203.9m lower than yesterday, 697.9m lower than the past week, 370.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 929m to a maximum of 2240m, averaging 1341.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 2040m and 1711.6m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

dew point temperature.description:
Today’s average dew point temperature is 3.7°C higher than yesterday, 3.6°C higher than the past week, 42.6°C lower than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between -2.8°C minimum and 9.4°C maximum, with an average of 8.6°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 5.0°C and 51.2°C.
dew point temperature.summary: Air will feel comfortable and balanced.

feels like temperature.description:
Today’s average feels like temperature is 3.5°C higher than yesterday, 2.7°C higher than the past week, 46.4°C lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the feels like temperatures ranged from a minimum of -4.7°C to a maximum of 10.9°C, averaging 8.3°C; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 5.6°C and 54.7°C respectively.
